intro: Nephrodium simulans, commonly known as the false fern, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and spadix inflorescence, typical of the arum family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near water bodies. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
